chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Operating While Suspended (Cause Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant James E. Mason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James E. Mason is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James E. Mason was found guilty of Knowingly Operating While Suspended (Cause Great Bodily Harm), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 6 days, if revoked.
May serve probation in Racine.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $1636.50 plus surcharges.  Bond to be applied.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Do not drive w/o valid DL.  May serve probation in Racine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Restitution released to victim WJ.  /  CK# 15CH073515
Associated with Charge #1
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Ct 1

Defendant, James E. Mason, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Sentence:
Ct 1:  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions and may transfer prob. to Racine.  6 days sentence credit if revoked.  Court costs ordered.  Restitution of $1,636.50 ordered, cash on deposit to be applied; rest. is not contested.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.  DL revoked for 6 months and not to drive without valid DL.  Appeal rights given.

Defendant, James E. Mason, appeared with Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Chike.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Defendant entered a plea of No Contest to Ct 1-Fel Knowingly Oper While Suspended, Cause Great Bodily Harm; found guilty by the court.  Ct 2 along w/  14TR804-14TR806 were dismissed.  PSI report ordered.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
